summary: The Quiet Communities Act of 2025 aims to reestablish the Office of Noise Abatement and Control within the Environmental Protection Agency. The bill addresses noise pollution in the U.S., citing its negative impacts on health and quality of life.  It mandates the Office to develop noise control programs, conduct research, disseminate information, and provide assistance to state and local governments.  A study on aircraft noise is also required.  The bill authorizes $25 million annually from 2026-2030 for the Office's operations.
